snippet: Recent vigilante-style killings of seven Palestinians suspected of providing intelligence to Israel highlighted the pathetic plight of collaborators.
abstract: Vigilante-style killings of seven Palestinians in Gaza, suspected of providing intelligence to Israel, highlight pathetic plight of collaborators, pawns preyed on by both sides in long-running Israeli-Palestinian conflict; for Israel, despite its advanced technology for tracking terrorists, human sources remain essential intelligence tool that allows for pinpoint strikes; to Hamas, they are the enemy within, and vigorous prosecution and occasional high-profile lynching are powerful psychological tools.

byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza, and Irit Pazner Garshowitz from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Recent vigilante-style killings of seven Palestinians suspected of providing intelligence to Israel highlighted the pathetic plight of collaborators.

headline.seo: Suspected Gaza Collaborators Face a Grisly Fate
headline.main: Collaboration in Gaza Leads to Grisly Fate
headline.print_headline: Collaboration In Gaza Leads To Grisly Fate

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
